key_channel_insights.line_content: With 86.85% of listings matching Singapore Airlines' web prices, OTAs show strong alignment, though 7.65% of OTA prices are higher.
MSE offers lower prices than Singapore Airlines' website in 71.34% of instances, maintaining a trend of competitive pricing.
GDS channels predominantly feature higher prices than Singapore Airlines' site, with 96% of cases exhibiting pricing above web offers.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 86.85% of OTA prices matched Singapore Airlines' website, showcasing strong price alignment.
7.65% of OTA listings were higher than web prices, a slight concern.
Lower offers on OTAs decreased to 1.22%, indicating less competitive positioning.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 4.28% of offers were not found on OTAs, consistent over time.
7.65% of OTA listings were priced higher than the website, marking an incremental increase.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 77.85% of short-haul itineraries matched website pricing, with a slight decrease recently.
94.71% of long-haul itineraries maintained parity with the web, reflecting strong alignment.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 94.27% of Singapore-origin itineraries matched web pricing, with minimal instances of higher OTA prices.
80.12% match rate for non-SG origins, with 14.62% of fares higher on OTA.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 86.19% price parity for close-in bookings aligns OTA and web offers.
88.03% parity for far-out bookings, with 17.1% offering lower OTA prices over time.

mse_highlights.line_content: 71.34% of MSE offers were lower than the website, reinforcing MSE's competitive pricing edge.
A 6.07% decrease in identical pricing between MSE and the airline's site was observed.
Price differences on MSE showed a marginal decrease of 0.04%.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 71.34% of MSE offers were lower than the airline's site, though slightly decreased from the prior week's 77.41%.
28.66% of tickets had the same price on MSE and the airline's site, reflecting a minor increase from the previous week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 59.76% of long haul flights had lower MSE prices, a 7.10% weekly decrease.
Short haul offers fell to 83.65% lower MSE pricing, down 5.10% from the previous week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 87.13% of non-SG routes had lower MSE prices, with a slight 3.23% decrease over last week.
53.85% lower MSE offers for Singapore-origin itineraries, a 10.61% decline from the previous week.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE prices were lower in 75.36% of cases for close-in bookings, despite a 4.46% weekly decline.
Far-out bookings showed a 64.10% lower MSE pricing, with an 8.40% decrease from the previous week.

gds_highlights.line_content: 96% of GDS prices are higher than Singapore Airlines' web prices, consistently seen over time.
Lower prices via GDS are below 1%, posing minimal competitive influence.
Slight improvements observed in price parity efforts on GDS channels.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 96% of GDS prices were higher than the website, stable over recent months.
'Same' pricing improved by 0.95% from last week, indicating progress in parity efforts.
Lower prices via GDS remain scant at approximately 0.3%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 94.94% of short haul itineraries had higher GDS prices last week, little change over time.
97.63% of long haul routes displayed higher GDS pricing, stable historically.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 94.23% of GDS prices for Singapore-origin routes were higher last week.
98.25% of non-SG origin itineraries featured higher GDS prices last week.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94.31% of close-in bookings on GDS were priced higher.
99.15% of far-out bookings on GDS showed higher prices last week, reflecting stability in advanced booking pricing.
